Reviews.Title: Way Better than I had Expected.
Reviews.Author: Thomas D.
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews after I had Purchased the TV, And I thought maybe it was a mistake. I gor it home removed it from the box and put the 6 small phillips head screws in the base and it was put together. Hooked it to high Definition Dish Network have beautiful picture in clear colorful High Def. The Sound is good in fact I had to turn it down to 4 out of 10 to keep from being too loud. I don"t know what everyone else was looking for in a $279.00 39" led TV, but I got more than I expected so Far. Unless it fries or something past the warranty I feel like I got a Very good Value for the money spent. My other Tvs are Samsung 47" Great TV, 32" LG Good TV.This one is almost as good as the Samsung, and Better than the LG as far as picture goes. Sound is much better on both, But I do have a Bose 123 on the Samsung so no problem. I would recommend this TV to anyone who wants a clear crisp 39" picture with good clear and loud sound. And you save money on top of it thanks Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Lionel
Reviews.Content: The TV is wonderful for what I paid for it! (Black Friday 2013)The only 'cons' about it would be that it only has 2 HDMI ports, which can fixed with a simple adapter, and the sound isn't the best.The sound isn't horrible, it's actually very manageable, but I highly recommend picking up a sound bar.It's a shame this TV only has 3 reviews on Amazon.Has 500+ on BestBuy's site. And don't worry, I checked the model numbers ^__^Has an avg. rating of 4.4/5 on there and I must say that's about right when it comes to this.If you want quality that isn't gonna break your bank, then pick this up.Insignia isn't the most known brand when it comes to TV's, but they sure do make quality products.Not to mention that it's made with LG parts...well, that'st what the Rep told me.I have an unboxing & review if you wanna check it out and judge the TV that way.http://youtu.be/s90f7OTvWOE

Reviews.Title: DOA - 13 months old
Reviews.Author: TakeOneForTheTeam
Reviews.Content: Do not buy an Insignia TV. Mine died 1 month past warranty. Customer Service rep suggested "never buy anything without the extended warranty"....I told him I've got a better idea. I'll leave a review on Amazon and share your suggestion. He was saying "well what I meant was" when I ended our connection.

Reviews.Title: Half of the screen is dim
Reviews.Author: Kevin Deutsch
Reviews.Content: After two weeks, the bottom half of the screen was dim and the whole screen was washed out. If the TV stayed on for an hour, the lamp in the bottom would suddenly illuminate and it would be fine. But if you buy this, keep an eye out for this phenomenon and return your TV.The TV is good for the price other than that. Be aware that there is only one set of component video inputs, and one set of RCA audio inputs. There are no RCA audio outs. For audio output, you only get a 1/8" mini jack and digital audio out. This doesn't work for everyone.If you want to use this for over-the-air TV reception, the receiver has no signal amplification so you'll want a good powered antenna. Regular rabbit ears won't cut it.Of note: the menu interface is designed well and the remote is alright.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: Frustrated Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this during the thanksgiving sale. Picture quality is good. Sound quality is good. Giving 4 stars, only since it has been just a week since I got it. This is my first LED tv as I have always loved plasmas, still love them.  Also this is my first 1080p TV.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: The TV Stand is a challenge to set up because the way they made it makes it hard.The TV gives a good picture ONLY if you mess with the settings and set them up to your liking. My tv is set up to a pre made setting .When you first turn it on its set to power saving mode .It looked horrible so keep that in mind before you judge it . You have to change it first.  This tv is best for HD channels because that's what it's made for so if you have HD channels your set to go.If not its still not bad it looks OK.This Tv looks bigger than a 39 inch tv that's good.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: David J Silchman
Reviews.Content: One of these came with our Redbird FMX full motion flight simulator to display the image of an airplane flying and doing whatever the simulator is simulating for people observing the simulator from the outside.. We got this one to connect as a remote viewing and placed it in the lobby for more people to see what the sim is doing. Both operate with the same remote.

Reviews.Title: Just don't understand!
Reviews.Author: bamafan
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand the problems people are having with this TV. My husband won it in December at his office Christmas party. We never heard of this brand before so we were not expecting much when we plugged it in. However I have to say I prefer this TV over our other ones. We used to have a Toshiba that was nice and had a great picture but the sound was terrible. Even with it turned all the way up you could barely hear it over our 3 kids. The sound on this TV is great. It is very clear and not tinny and pretty loud. The picture is beautiful for the price you pay. We have not had any problems with ours at all and in fact it is the first TV I look for when we are replacing all of our tube TVs. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Looked great until it failed at 2 years old.
Reviews.Author: EPA316
Reviews.Content: I bought a 42" LED Insignia tv at Best Buy, because of the way it looked and also because of the low price. It looked great, and performed flawlessly, until one day just over two years after I got it, I have sound but no picture. I did some reading around online and, lo and behold, this is a very common problem. Looking at some of the other reviews, it looks like mine lasted longer than some others did. Estimates for tv repairs start at about $150, and that's just for the diagnosis, and I'm not willing to pour more money into a cheap tv. I know it's tempting to go for the screaming bargain knock-off brand at the store, just remember, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Biker Dude 2000 "Biker"
Reviews.Content: I finally upgraded from a 25" tube TV. And I'm ok with my purchase.If you channel surf all day you wont like it, there is about a 1/2 second lag in between changes.Bouncing around looking for something to watch can be painful because it feels like forever.If you watch DVDs/movies like me you'll be impressed by the image quality.If you are on a budget its perfect.I picked up a Chrome cast to go with it. I'll post on that when I get some more use.

Reviews.Title: screen went black after 4 months
Reviews.Author: nazareno silvestri
Reviews.Content: got it on a black thursday sale for $169.99. best buy will replace with like model because the screen is not availabe and they no longer carry it

Reviews.Title: Broke in 18 days!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Houston
Reviews.Content: We bought the 50" version less than a month ago and it's already broken.  It was two days past the 15 day return date and it's like pulling teeth to get anyone to fix it!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY INSIGNIA!
Reviews.Author: Admac
Reviews.Content: Three years ago we purchased an Insignia DVD player. Now it is outdated and will not play new Blu rays . We called Insignia regarding this, and they said tough luck. One manager went as far as you say the customer is always wrong. Please spread the word on this share this with everyone you know. I can't believe a company would be so awful. After 3 years a Blu ray player will not work on new movies anymore . That is ridiculous not to mention it's environmentally harmful to make an electronic that will only last three years ! Please share this with everyone. Do not buy Insignia!
